info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 7:04PM EDT until June 27 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
FFWFFC
The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Cherokee County in north central Georgia... Forsyth County in north central Georgia... Northeastern Fulton County in north central Georgia... Southwestern Hall County in north central Georgia...
* Until 1000 PM EDT.
* At 704 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gainesville, Canton, Cumming, Mountain Park, Roswell, Alpharetta, Milton, Woodstock, Sugar Hill, Buford, Holly Springs, Flowery Branch, Oakwood, Ball Ground, Nelson, Waleska, Rest Haven, Free Home and Buffington.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee, GA; Forsyth, GA; Fulton, GA; Hall, GA
